I added a very simple extension for JBuilder4 (actually I didn't try 
it with JBuilder3.5, but I think it would work). 

http://home.carolina.rr.com/mitrovic/junit

It makes life a little bit easier. It also gives you a possibility to 
choose which TestCase to start if there are several of those in the 
Java source file. It can also start static inner TestCase class (my 
favourite way of testing private memebers of the class using JUnit).

regards
Ivan
subject: JUnit for JBuilder4
